comments.content:
DeRoos Caps

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.dafont.com/en/font.php?file=deroos_caps&page=&nb_ppp_old=10&text=TREVISO&nb_ppp=10&classt=alpha) is Dave Fabik’s version with documentation.

[Here](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/erbar/urw-d-normal/testdrive.html?s=TREVISO&p=72) is a better digitization called Erbar.

And David Nalle’s version, [Brandegoris](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/brandegoris/brandegoris/testdrive.html?s=TREVISO&p=72), which includes lots of nifty alternates.

OK, this appears in the Solotype Catalog as Erbar Initials, so I assume that it was designed by Jakob Erbar rather than S.H. de Roos. Can anyone confirm this (and maybe even give a year)?
Thank you for the info - well done.

No year given, but definitely designed by Jakob Erbar, see:  
 [http://www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftdesigner/Erbar/JErbar.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.klingspor-museum.de/KlingsporKuenstler/Schriftdesigner/Erbar/JErbar.pdf)

Thanks Sander!

Funny, I was just on your website a few minutes ago checking your Nick Curtis font notes and sources. I thought that he’d made a font based on Roco, but I guess I was mistaken.

You’re right, he never did (alas, I might add). But there are some other variants of Roco (which is a redesign of Grock) I think are beautiful too. If you are interested, check P22 Art Deco (Carima Al Behairy, P22), GangueOuais (Darren Rigby, Starving 4 Entertainment) and Signum (a Grockified Broadway by Karl Nayeri, Prime Graphics).  
The Belgian company Alfac had a font called Spats but it was never digitized.

Yes, there are lots of fonts that have bits and pieces of Roco. Others include Marquee Mieux (WSI), [Dalith](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.elfring.com/artdeco1.htm) (Elfring), and [Lullaby](http://web.archive.org/web/20060604052355/http:/www.buyfonts.com/value_for_money/lullaby.htm) (Fontbank).
